posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.25 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here .

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No user-facing changes

Complete list of new commits since 7.24.2
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.24.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.24 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.25.0 (148500)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

39 new commits since 7.24.2:

Show commits

  • Update registration for new restore flows. [1]

  • Add utility method to get amount of free space available to device data partition. [2]

  • Add support for upgrades from warning sheet. [3]

  • Convert RegistrationValues to kotlin. [4]

  • Convert StorageSyncHelper to kotlin. [5]

  • Convert AccountRecordProcessor to kotlin. [6]

  • Convert GroupV1RecordProcessor to kotlin. [7]

  • Convert GroupV2RecordProcessor to kotlin. [8]

  • Convert StoryDistributionListRecordProcessor to kotlin. [9]

  • Convert StorageSyncModels to kotlin. [10]

  • Utilize re-entrant locking for in app payments instead of synchronized blocks. [11]

  • Fix extraneous incremental chunk sizes. [12]

  • Fix disabled media send button. [13]

  • Pass in the end-of-period value to the media backups are off alert fragment. [14]

  • Wire in endOfPeriod time. [15]

  • Fix theme transitions in chats. [16]

  • Remove cruft around SignalAccountRecord. [17]

  • Simplify SignalStorageRecord. [18]

  • Fix image-editor build. [19]

  • Include call link count when determining total content count of calls tab. [20]

  • Fix about row color in app settings. [21]

  • Convert StorageAccountRestoreJob to kotlin. [22]

  • Disable billing api on staging. [23]

  • Remove some unused device linking code. [24]

  • Convert MultiDeviceKeysUpdateJob to kotlin. [25]

  • Update method by which we check for remote device count. [26]

  • Filter out cancelled subscriptions in 'isInProgress' check [27]

  • Convert StorageServiceValues to kotlin. [28]

  • Convert SignalStorageCipher and keys to kotlin. [29]

  • The rest of the storage service unwrapping. [30]

  • Convert SignalStorageManifest to kotlin. [31]

  • Add user restore method selection plumbing to old device. [32]

  • Improve documentation around code formatting and dependencies. [33]

  • Fix typo in prompt to navigate to settings. [34]

    Resolves #13779

  • Remove Apache http client dependency. [35]

    Resolves #13786

  • Fix CI by bumping heap size to 12GB. [36]

  • Fix icon scaling. [37]

  • Update translations and other static files. [38]

  • Bump version to 7.25.0 [39]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.24.2…v7.25.0

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: interesting, quite a lot of things moved to kotlin!

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Can’t receive a call from a user. They are using a VPN, but it stays stuck on Connecting.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.25.0/bafab42276d457b623e0e181a2767c97ae3f6020f4f63d67cd6fcc3eaa03fb0f

Their side:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.23.1/9d32aeb0f6e3f55ae5352d42bfc22607a87ab43eaf66bf1acee000aaca515b09

Screenshot_20241114-205306583×676 42.6 KB

How many times will I need to report, before this bug gets even acknowledged?
Report it on GitHub if this has been there for multiple versions.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Wojtaz0w:

How many times will I need to report, before this bug gets even acknowledged?

I read all, but I don’t necessarily respond to every single thing :) The truth is that in the realm of bugs, this doesn’t quite cross my threshold of something we have to fix at this very moment. It doesn’t mean we don’t want to fix it, but when you’re a handful of people with lots of things to do, it’s a fact of life that some stuff just doesn’t get prioritized.

But thank you very much for bringing it up! Always love pull requests for small things like this :)

I can’t paste images copied from, say, browser.

I can some images, but not others, for some reason. Trying to paste the image from the keyboard’s integrated clipboard says “Signal does not support image pasting here”.

But “share image” works.

Please don’t tell me it’s an image format thing.

Edited messages show up as time-stamped with the time the edit happens, not the time the original message was sent. Expected behavior is the edited message retains the original timestamp, with all individual times being visible upon viewing edit history.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.25.0/b2cb0a21e61d75439729a6d18faaeb7cbc5cf8ab584937546a0c28b35f2dfda6

mrandr01d:

bug are you referring to?

Look at the top left and right, the rounded highlight.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.22 release Android Beta Feedback
There’s no need to repeat the same issue every thread. Since this is also not related to the latest beta changes and there are no commits related to fixing this, you should open a Github issue rather than post the same issue over and over again, as it is no longer beta feedback. If it has been present since 7.12 it’s no longer related to beta changes. Just tried sending a video twice and it just…disappeared?? https://debuglogs.org/android/7.22.2/15872876c0bee3f5530e4aa6f9dabf2c99e0fba290c088f…

This is relevant. Your post is off topic.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.22 release

posts.name: Antony
posts.cooked: Why is it when I am using a Bluetooth headset and listening to voice message that the phone uses the proximity sensor !? No logic whatsoever in that

I just added a group chat to the 1:1 chats folder, and now I can’t remove it from there (it has no Remove from folder menu item, only Delete).

I think it should not have been possible to add anything to the “auto folders” in the first place (Unread was also offered as a choice when I used Add to folder on this conversation).

anon54919998:

I think it should not have been possible to add anything to the “auto folders” in the first place

The “auto folders” are not special. They are just ordinary folders that are preconfigured in specific ways. Once you have added the “1:1 chats” folder, you can edit it and change up the included list and exceptions however you want. That is why you can also just add anything you want to it using the “Add to folder” option.

If you do edit it or add other chats to it, you’ll see that the “1:1 chats” entry shows back up in the settings menu as an option to add.

anon54919998:

I just added a group chat to the 1:1 chats folder, and now I can’t remove it from there (it has no Remove from folder menu item, only Delete).

This definitely is a bug. It seems the UI doesn’t recognize that the chat is in the folder. However, this is happening in production and so isn’t beta feedback at this point – it needs to be reported on GitHub.

As a workaround, you can edit the folder and remove the group chat from that screen.

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
Calls aren’t disabling the screen, even though the proximity sensor is completely functional in other apps. Very annoying. This has been happening for the last releases. Can you take a look into this, please?

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.24.2/2fb39163c113fb14f799b51c711d90fe420ccc06fd8e9093a669e1c5ded2bd52
